variable.name: uhdrsage
variable.description: Age at baseline UHDRS (Unified Huntington's Disease Rating Scale)

variable.name: uhdrsdays
variable.description: Days since last UHDRS (Unified Huntington's Disease Rating Scale)

variable.name: uhdrs25a
variable.value: Seldom, less than once a week
Sometimes, at least once a week
Very frequently, almost all the time

variable.name: uhdrs25b
variable.value: Mild, responds to redirection and reassurance
Severe, significant suffering and loss of functioning

variable.name: uhdrs26a
variable.value: Seldom apathetic, less than once a week
Sometimes, at least once a week
Very frequently, almost all the time

variable.name: uhdrs26b
variable.value: Mild apathy, not initiating conversation or activity but is responsive
Moderate apathy, sometimes responds to efforts to get involved
Severe apathy, generally unresponsive to attempts to involve participant

variable.name: uhdrs27a
variable.value: Seldom, less than once a week
Sometimes, at least once a week
Very frequently, almost all the time

variable.name: uhdrs27b
variable.value: Severe, causing a restriction of activities

variable.name: uhdrs28a
variable.value: Not thinking about suicide or self harm
Seldom, less than once a month
Sometimes, at least once a month
Frequently, at least once a week
Often, sometimes for days and weeks on end

variable.name: uhdrs28b
variable.value: No thoughts at current time, but talks of suicide as potential option
Seriously considered suicide but has no plan
Has a plan but no active preparations
Has a plan and is actively preparing

variable.name: uhdrs29a
variable.value: Seldom, less than once a week
Sometimes, at least once a week
Very frequently, almost all the time

variable.name: uhdrs29b
variable.value: Severe, causing a profound restriction of activities

variable.name: uhdrs30a
variable.value: Seldom, less than once a week
Sometimes, at least once a week
Very frequently, almost all the time

variable.name: uhdrs30b
variable.value: Moderate, others change behavior to avoid irritating participant

variable.name: uhdrs31a
variable.value: Seldom, less than once a month
Sometimes, at least once a month
Frequently, at least once a week

variable.name: uhdrs31b
variable.value: Mild physically or verbally threatening behavior
Clear physical threat (moderate aggression); bumping, shoving, verbal outburst
Clear physical threat (severe aggression); striking/hitting, definite intention to cause injury

variable.name: uhdrs32a
variable.value: Seldom, less than once a week
Sometimes, at least once a week
Very frequently, almost all the time

variable.name: uhdrs32b
variable.value: Gets stuck on certain ideas but can be easily redirected
Moderate; gets stuck on certain ideas and difficult to redirect
Severe; gets stuck on certain ideas, and does not respond to redirection

variable.name: uhdrs33a
variable.value: Seldom, less than once a week
Sometimes, at least once a week
Very frequently, almost all the time

variable.name: uhdrs33b
variable.value: Equivocal; has a mild impulse not sufficient to act on
Mild; has impulse, acts on impulse but can stop
Moderate; has impulse, acts on it, and sometimes cannot stop
Severe; has impulse, acts on it, and cannot stop

variable.name: uhdrs34a
variable.value: Seldom, less than once a month
Sometimes, at least once a month
Frequently, at least once a week
Often, sometimes for days on end

variable.name: uhdrs34b
variable.value: Has delusional idea, not sure it is true
Convinced of idea but allows that the idea is not true
Utterly convinced of the idea(s), but not acting on them
Utterly convinced of the idea(s), behavior is determined by the delusion(s)

variable.name: uhdrs35a
variable.value: Seldom, less than once a month
Sometimes, at least once a month
Frequently, at least once a week
Often, sometimes for days on end

variable.name: uhdrs35b
variable.value: Has hallucinations, but not sure that they are real
Convinced of the reality of the hallucinations but allows that it is possible that they are not real and not acting on them
Utterly convinced of the hallucinations being real, but not acting on them
Severe; has hallucinations that are vivid, is utterly convinced that they are real, and the hallucinations impact behavior

variable.name: uhdrs36
variable.description: Examiner believes the participant is confused

variable.name: uhdrs37
variable.description: Examiner believes the participant is demented

variable.name: uhdrs38
variable.description: Examiner believes the participant is depressed

variable.name: uhdrs_ba
variable.description: Sum of all frequency and severity scores

variable.name: uhdrs_bafs
variable.description: Sum of product of frequency and severity scores
